logic.operator

Interface Operator

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Logic
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Biconditional, Conditional, Conjunction, Disjunction, Negation, Sentence

    public interface Operator
extends Logic
    An operator is either biconditional <=>, conditional =>, disjunction |, conjunction & or negation ~.
    Author:
    Devon

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods

      Takes a clause string and finds the first piece of logic outside of any brackets and returns the start location within the string.

      • Methods inherited from interface logic.Logic

        evaluate, getLiterals

    • Method Detail

      • setTerms

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Literal> setTerms(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Literal> terms)
        Set the literals of all following logic operators to be the same literal objects.
        Parameters:
        terms - a hashmap of the name of the literal and the literal itself.
        Returns:
        a new hashmap with the updated literals.

      • getPremise

        Logic getPremise()
        Gets the premise of any logical operator.
        Returns:
        the premise or the left side of the operator.

      • getConclusion

        Logic getConclusion()
        Gets the conclusion of any logical operator.
        Returns:
        the conclusion or the right side of any operator.

      • findBracketNeutrality

        default int findBracketNeutrality(java.lang.String sentence)
        Takes a clause string and finds the first piece of logic outside of any brackets and returns the start location within the string.
        Parameters:
        sentence - the sentence to check for bracket neutral logic.
        Returns:
        an integer representing the character position of the start of the logic symbol that is not between brackets or the location of the logic symbol.

      • trimOuterBrackets

        default java.lang.String trimOuterBrackets(java.lang.String string)
        If the input string has a bracket set surrounding it, remove them.
        Parameters:
        string - the string to check for brackets.
        Returns:
        the string or the string without the surrounding brackets if there were any.

      • findLogicSymbol

        default int findLogicSymbol(java.lang.String sentence)
        Returns the index of the first logic symbol contained in the string.
        Parameters:
        sentence - String of literals with logic operators.
        Returns:
        index of first logic symbol or -1 if none exists.
